article.headline: Gardner's 3 lifts American past Lehigh, 62-59
article.story: WASHINGTON, D.C. -- Pee Wee Gardner stroked in a 3-pointer with 0.8 seconds left to lift American University past Lehigh in a Patriot League game Wednesday night. Austin Price hit the second of two free throws with 1:39 left to give American the lead, 59-57, but Tim Kempton knocked down a jumper with 9 seconds left to tie it at 59. Jesse Reed scored 27 points, 16 in the first half, to lead the Eagles (10-7, 3-2 Patriot), with Charlie Jones adding another 11 points. Gardner finished with eight points by hitting 2 of 4 from behind the arc. Kempton, the reigning Patriot League Rookie of the Year, finished with 24 points and 13 rebounds to lead Lehigh (7-9, 1-4). Price added another 13 points. On Saturday, Gardner scored five points in the final 13 seconds of regulation to force overtime in the Eagles' 71-69 double overtime win over Colgate.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
